title: The marked price of a watch has a profit component of X% over the cost price of Rs. X. if the marked price were to be Rs. 416, what is the cost price? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to given problem,The marked price of a watch has a profit component of X% over the cost price of Rs. X. if the marked price were to be Rs. 416, what is the cost price?We know thatMP = [1 + (profit component)/100]*CPHence from the given data we get following relation,416 = (1 + X/100)*Xor X^2 + 100*X - 41600or (X + 260)*(X - 160) = 0 or X = 160 (Rs) [Ans][X cannot be negative]
Assuming that there is no discount given. The marked price will be equal to selling price. So, Using the basic formula of SP and CP, we get (100+X)*X/100=416 Solving, we get X=160.So, CP=160
